sections.title: Lead

sentence_evaluations.sentence: **Glutamate ionotropic receptor AMPA type subunit 2** (Glutamate receptor 2, or GluR-2) is a [protein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protein) that in humans is encoded by the *GRIA2* (or *GLUR2*) [gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene) and it is a subunit found in the [AMPA receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMPA_receptor).

requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The requirement is fully met as the gene abbreviations are in italics, adhering to the imperative standard.

requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Partial adherence; while abbreviations are used, the inclusion of the full gene name suggests that the abbreviation is not preferred as per the guideline.

sections.title: Function

sentence_evaluations.sentence: [Glutamate receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glutamate_receptor) are the predominant excitatory [neurotransmitter receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurotransmitter_receptor) in the [mammalian brain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mammalian_brain) and are activated in a variety of normal neurophysiologic processes.

This gene product belongs to a family of glutamate receptors that are sensitive to [AMPA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMPA) (alpha-amino-3-hydroxy-5-methyl-4-isoxazole propionate), called [AMPA receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMPA_receptor), and function as [ligand-activated cation channels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligand-gated_ion_channel#Ionotropic_glutamate_receptors).
These channels are assembled from a combination of 4 subunits, encoded by 4 genes (*GRIA1-4*).

requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The requirement is fully met as the gene abbreviations are in italics, adhering to the imperative standard.

requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The requirement is fully met as abbreviations are used instead of full gene names, adhering to the best practice.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The subunit encoded by this gene (*GRIA2*) is subject to [RNA editing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RNA_editing) which renders the receptor that it becomes part of impermeable to [calcium ions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calcium_in_biology) (Ca<sup>2+</sup>).

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Human and animal studies suggest that the RNA editing is essential for normal brain function and defective RNA editing of this gene may be relevant to the etiology of [amyotrophic lateral sclerosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amyotrophic_lateral_sclerosis) (ALS).

[Alternative splicing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alternative_splicing), resulting in transcript variants encoding different [isoforms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protein_isoform), has been noted for this gene, which includes the generation of flip and flop isoforms that vary in their [signal transduction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signal_transduction) properties.

[Glutamate receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glutamate_receptor) are the predominant excitatory [neurotransmitter receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurotransmitter_receptor) in the [mammalian brain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mammalian_brain) and are activated in a variety of normal neurophysiologic processes.

This gene product belongs to a family of glutamate receptors that are sensitive to [AMPA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMPA) (alpha-amino-3-hydroxy-5-methyl-4-isoxazole propionate), called [AMPA receptors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMPA_receptor), and function as [ligand-activated cation channels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ligand-gated_ion_channel#Ionotropic_glutamate_receptors).
These channels are assembled from a combination of 4 subunits, encoded by 4 genes (*GRIA1-4*).

These channels are assembled from a combination of 4 subunits, encoded by 4 genes (*GRIA1-4*).

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Glutamate-gated ion channels are made up of four subunits per channel, with each subunit contributing to the pore loop structure.
The pore loop structure is related to that found in K<sup>+</sup> channels (e.g., human [Kv1.1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kv1.1) channel).
The human Kv1.1 channel pre mRNA is also subject to A to I RNA editing.
The function of the glutamate receptors is in the mediation of fast neurotransmission to the brain.
The diversity of the subunits is determined, as well as RNA splicing by RNA editing events of the individual subunits.
This give rise to the necessarily high diversity of these receptors.
Glur2 is a gene product of the pre-mRNA of the GRIA2 gene and subject to RNA editing.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Glutamate-gated ion channels are made up of four subunits per channel, with each subunit contributing to the pore loop structure.
The pore loop structure is related to that found in K<sup>+</sup> channels (e.g., human [Kv1.1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kv1.1) channel).
The human Kv1.1 channel pre mRNA is also subject to A to I RNA editing.
The function of the glutamate receptors is in the mediation of fast neurotransmission to the brain.
The diversity of the subunits is determined, as well as RNA splicing by RNA editing events of the individual subunits.
This give rise to the necessarily high diversity of these receptors.
Glur2 is a gene product of the pre-mRNA of the GRIA2 gene and subject to RNA editing.
